**** Noun[edit] ****
चि (ci)

***** Newar[edit] *****
**** Etymology[edit] ****
From Classical_Newar 𑐔𑐷 (cī), perhaps from Proto-Sino-Tibetan *tsa (“salt”).
Cognate to Thangmi छ्या, Chepang छेः.
**** Pronunciation[edit] ****
    * IPA(key): [t͡ɕi]
**** Noun[edit] ****
चि • (ci) ? (Newa Spelling 𑐔𑐶)
   1. salt

**** Pronunciation[edit] ****
    * (Vedic) IPA(key): /t͡ɕi/
    * (Classical) IPA(key): /t͡ɕi/
**** Etymology 1[edit] ****
From Proto-Indo-European *kʷey- (“to collect, gather, pile, build”).
*** Root[edit] ***
चि • (ci)
   1. to arrange in order, pile up, construct
   2. to collect, gather, accumulate, acquire
   3. to cover, inlay
** Derived terms[edit] **
    * चित (citá)
    * चिता (citā́)
    * चिनोति (cinóti)
 
**** Etymology 2[edit] ****
From Proto-Indo-European *kʷey- (“to observe, perceive”).
*** Root[edit] ***
चि • (ci)
   1. to observe, perceive
   2. to fix the gaze upon, be intent upon
   3. to seek for, investigate, search through
